info.description: Principal and Interest Factors (PIFs) generally represent the amount of payment per 1000 of Original Face currency units value you currently hold in the given asset, and are used in conjunction with position data to generate cashflows. This API allows for filtering and retrieval of PIF records based on a number of criteria including assetId, dates, security groups, currency and more.
info.title: Principal and Interest Factor

get.description:
Retrieves unique PIF record
(-- api-linter: core::0131::http-uri-id=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because the resource doesn't have a non-composite id --)
get.summary: Gets a Principal Interest Factor record

Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

PrincipalInterestFactorPrincipalInterest.title: PrincipalInterestFactorDetail refers to the accrual breakdown for multi-accrual assets over fixed or varying balance

id.title: The id of the factor detail

pifSequenceNumber.title: The sequence number of the pif for this factor detail

accrualType.title: Represents the type of fee or interest being accrued

interestAccrualDate.title: Start of the interest accrual range

interestAccrualEndDate.title: End of the interest accrual range

entryDate.title: Entry date of the factor detail

calculationDaysConvention.title: Date calc basis used in calculations

couponSource.title: Source of coupon (controlled by decode PMT_CPN_SOURCE)

periodDayCount.title: Number of days in the period

nominalPaymentDate.title: Nominal payment date (i.e. Unadjusted payment date)

finalPayment.description:
Represents whether this is the final payment.
Final payments are ignored by gen_pni and the amount is posted as a trade by rm_mat.

PrincipalInterestFactorState.description:
- STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified state
 - STATE_PROJECTED: The calculated amount may change and is not final yet
 - STATE_DONE: Calculations for this reset are complete
 - STATE_ERROR: Accrual calculation failed
 - STATE_FACTOR_WAIT: Calculation is incomplete due to missing Factor data
 - STATE_MANUAL: Manually amended accrual values
PrincipalInterestFactorState.title: Possible status for principal and interest

rpcStatus.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

typesRangeValue.title:
Range values
Field end_date is ignored if used with a comparison operator

v1Audit.title: Audit refers to the change history

modifier.title: Represents user-id of the user who changed

modifiedVia.title:
Application that changed it
(-- api-linter: core::0142::time-field-names=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: Agraph team said to keep the word modify consistent. --)

v1AuditQuery.title: Query for Principal Interest Factor Audit Filter

key.title:
Retrieve Principal Interest Factor for this key
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: key is a local field for Principal Interest Factor api --)

startDate.title: startDate for when revision was made

endDate.title: endDate for when revision was made

results.title: Results for each PIF to be created
Results of each PIF to be updated

v1ChangeType.description:
- CHANGE_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecidied
 - CHANGE_TYPE_INSERT: Insert
 - CHANGE_TYPE_UPDATE: Update
 - CHANGE_TYPE_DELETE: Delete
v1ChangeType.title: Type of change

v1Comparison.description:
Comparison operators compare two operands and yield a boolean value. Unlike
in most programming languages, field names must appear on the left-hand side
of a comparison operator; the right-hand side only accepts literals and
logical operators.

 - COMPARISON_UNSPECIFIED: Default value
 - COMPARISON_LESS_EQUALS: The given `field` is less than the given `value`.
 - COMPARISON_LESS_THAN: The given `field` is less than or equal to the given `value`.
 - COMPARISON_GREATER_EQUALS: The given `field` is greater than or equal to the given `value`.
 - COMPARISON_GREATER_THAN: The given `field` is greater than the given `value`.
 - COMPARISON_NOT_EQUALS: The given `field` is not equal to the given `value`.
 - COMPARISON_EQUALS: The given `field` is equal to the given `value`.

error.title: Error message in case of failed create operation

output.title: Created PIF in case of successful operation

v1FilterCriteria.title: Contains filter parameters along with logical operator for predicates

v1Logical.description:
Logical operators apply to boolean values and yield a result of the same type
as the operands. The right operand is evaluated conditionally. To match
common patterns of speech, the OR operator has higher precedence than AND,
unlike what is found in most programming languages. The expression a AND b OR
c evaluates: a AND (b OR c).

 - LOGICAL_UNSPECIFIED: Default value
 - LOGICAL_OR: LOGICAL_OR indicates an OR condition. If any of the two operands is true,
then condition becomes true, otherwise it is false.
 - LOGICAL_AND: LOGICAL_AND indicates an AND condition. If both the operands are true, then
condition becomes true, othwerwise it is false.
 - LOGICAL_NOT: LOGICAL_NOT indicates a NOT condition. Use to reverses the logical state of
its operand. If a condition is true then Logical NOT operator will make
false.

v1ParameterName.description:
- PARAMETER_NAME_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified parameter name
 - PARAMETER_NAME_ASSET_IDS: Represents one or more asset identifiers on which filtering should be applied
 - PARAMETER_NAME_RECORD_DATE: Represents starting range of record date of the PIF
 - PARAMETER_NAME_PAYMENT_DATE: Represents starting range of payment date of the PIF
 - PARAMETER_NAME_MODIFY_DATE: Represents starting range of modify date of the PIF (i.e. entry date)
 - PARAMETER_NAME_CURRENCY_CODES: Represents one or more currencies on which filtering should be applied
 - PARAMETER_NAME_SECURITY_GROUP_AND_TYPE: Represents security group and type
 - PARAMETER_NAME_REC_SOURCE: Source against which this PIF has been reconciled
 - PARAMETER_NAME_PRINCIPAL_ACCRUAL_DATE: Represents starting range of principal accrual date of the PIF
 - PARAMETER_NAME_INTEREST_ACCRUAL_DATE: Represents starting range of interest accrual date of the PIF
 - PARAMETER_NAME_COUPON_TYPE: Represents coupon type of the PIF
 - PARAMETER_NAME_PAYMENT_SETTLE_LOCATION: Represents payment settle location of the PIF
 - PARAMETER_NAME_PRINCIPAL_STATUS: Represents principal status of the PIF
 - PARAMETER_NAME_INTEREST_STATUS: Represents interest status of the PIF
 - PARAMETER_NAME_CONFIRMED_STATUS: Represents confirmed status of the PIF
 - PARAMETER_NAME_CONFIRMED_BY: Represents confirmed by of the PIF
 - PARAMETER_NAME_PAYMENT_SOURCE: Represents payment source by of the PIF
v1ParameterName.title: Name of the parameter on basis of which PIFs will be filtered

v1ParameterValue.title: Value that the parameter in filter criteria possess

repeatedValue.title: Repeated values i.e., list of objects

v1PrincipalInterestFactor.title: PrincipalInterestFactor refers Principal and Interest Factor (PIF) data object

id.description: Name describes the computer or human assigned resource identifier.

recordDate.title: represents record date of the PIF (i.e. trade date)

paymentDate.title: represents payment date of the PIF (i.e. settle date)

coupon.title: coupon value used for p/i calculation

periodDayCount.title: number of days in this period

source.title: source of this PIF (controlled by decode PMT_SOURCE)

nominalPaymentDate.title: Nominal payment date (aka unadjusted payment date)

reconSource.title: Source against which this PIF has been reconciled (controlled by decode REMIT_SOURCE)

couponSource.title: Source of coupon (controlled by decode PMT_CPN_SOURCE)

finalPayment.description:
Represents whether this is the final payment.
Final payments are ignored by gen_pni and the amount is posted as a trade by rm_mat.

principalInterestFactorDetails.title: Represents the list of factor details associated with this principal interest factor

updateMask.title: List of fields to be updated

error.title: Error message in case of failed update operation

output.title: Updated PIF in case of successful operation

OAuth2AccessCode.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the access code flow.

scopes.investment_operations.asset_lifecycle.pr: This grants access to all endpoints in the investment_operations.asset_lifecycle.principal_interest_factor.v1.PrincipalInterestFactor API
scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.

OAuth2ClientCredentials.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the client credentials flow.

scopes.investment_operations.asset_lifecycle.pr: This grants access to all endpoints in the investment_operations.asset_lifecycle.principal_interest_factor.v1.PrincipalInterestFactor API
scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.
